Post_Title: The reason God hated man after he gained knowledge of good and evil was because now man could understand that God is evil.
post_text:
In a previous post i explained how if God exists he would be evil. A lot of responses I got from Christians was that God ways were unknowable, or humans can't hope to understand God, basically variations of "He works in mysterious ways" and that God loves free will so he doesn't take away our ability to do evil.

.

My theory is rooted in the story of the very first sin. God punished Adam and Eve for eating from the tree of knowledge of good and evil by banishing them and their descendents to suffer and die even though they were deceived by a serpent. But the punishment seems like overkill, It's like punishing a toddler who ate a cake when told not to, by condemning them to suffer painfully and die along with all their descendents (Adam and Eve were basically toddlers at this point not in body but in mind).

.

So now the reason why I think god gave such a disproportionate punishment was because man now had the ability to judge good and evil and the ability to deduce that God was evil.
(explained in the previous post, link in comments).

.

As for free will God doesn't really care for it because he hardened Pharaoh's heart simply to display his might, made an evil spirit trouble Saul to skew his judgement and skewed his judgement himself, to aid Gideon he made the Midianites turn their swords against each other, he took away Nebuchadnezzar's reason, and when Jonah used his free will God punished Jonah till he changed his mind.
